history.content:
First, I think there is some typo in the paragraph below as shown in my strike-through, please confirm.

Consider an input to the INDEPENDENT SET problem. Denote this input as the graph H = (V;E) and an integer k. Now we'll construct the input to the SUBGRAPH ISOMORPHISM problem. Let G = (VV', EE') be the graph where |V'| =k and E' ={} ;

Secondly, can we really define a graph G here by simply specifying the number of vertices k?   The algorithm to construct G from input H is not really defined here and I wonder if we could use "jumps" like this in the exam.

Never mind second part, I came to my senses.  I was just thinking hard for problem 8.3 in reverse direction, i.e. reducing STINGY SAT => SAT.
history.subject: clarifications on practice problem solution for 8.10 part a
